title: Are there two competing theories in science that explain the same thing and are relatively equally popular among reputable scientists? - Quora

response.answer_text: Black holes especially where relativity and quantum mechanics meet are always battle grounds where theories and theorists clash. One recent debate is on the black hole firewall paradox (see: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/13/science/space/a-black-hole-mystery-wrapped-in-a-firewall-paradox.html?_r=1). Well, recent is "recent" it is actually a new chapter in a long debate started with Stephen Hawking in the '70s on the properties of black holes. Well this is constantly in flux, methinks, but here are some off-the-top-0f-my-head that have gone back-and-forth in terms of dominance and mutual popularity over time: Behaviorism vs. Cognitive PsychPunctuated Equilibrium vs. Gradualism (Evolutionary Theory)Nature vs. Nurture (as found in many disciplines; for example, Genetic vs. Environmental or Epigenetic causes of Autism Spectrum Disorder; Nativism vs. Interactionism in Linguistics, etc.)Various Superstring Theories (and/or Theories that Unite all Versions of Superstring Theory).LQG vs. Superstring TheoryDifferent Explanations and Indications of Amphibian Die-Off (and Other Mass Extinctions)Whether Cell Phones, Coffee, ELF-EMFs, etc. Cause Cancer....Thanks for the A2A.

Loop quantum gravity vs String theory. There are two groups representing these intellectual revolution in theoretical physics. Loop quantum gravity is headed by Ashtekar, Smolin, Rovelli, Thiemann, Baez etc. All these are highly eminent physicists. String theory is headed by Witten, Gross, Maldacena, Vafa, Greene, Kaku, Sen, etc. Both these theories describe quantum gravity, though these are not complete theories as yet and have a plethora of conceptual and technical issues.

The best example of such a pair that I can think of is Einsteinian General Relativity versus Quantum Mechanics.Neither has failed any test of its predictions even at extreme precision, and yet in some respects they contradict each other.
